text: hi guys Greg here deputy food editor and
host of the slice welcome to my very
tiny apartment kitchen in Brooklyn like
many of you I've been cooking a lot at
home and trying to keep things
interesting and delicious one thing I go
to all the time at least once a week is
Pizza and based on what I could find in
my pantry in fridge this morning I'm
making a riff on our skillet pizza
diabla the recipes up on the website and
as the name would imply of course it
starts with a skillet I have this
beautiful heavy cast-iron if you don't
have a cast-iron skillet you could also
do this in a stainless steel or you
could even do it in a rimmed baking
sheet important thing to do first of
course is to pre-heat your oven to 425
degrees and let me just show you the
ingredients I have I do not have feta
but I do have ricotta so I'm using that
instead in addition to of course the old
mozzarella cheese I did have some of
that in my fridge I don't have any
Italian sausage but I did find some
breakfast sausage in my freezer so it's
currently thawing and then I'll just
slice this into little rounds I don't
have kalamata olives
but I did find a jar of green olives in
the pantry so I'm gonna slice these up
and I cheat - I did not make marinara
but I always keep emergency jar of my
favorite Rao's and I had some left over
from a pasta dish I made earlier in the
week so we'll be using that and fresh
oregano which I had you can use dry or
skip it all together if you don't have
it basil would work to finish and hot
pepper this is a Fresno you could use a
jalapeno Serrano chili flakes whatever
you've got to add a little heat and a
lot of oil in the bottom of the skillet
that's gonna make the dough really
crispy and I've been I made this three
days ago I think and I've let it very
slowly rise new fridge
and you can see it's got beautiful
pockets of air all over it this dough
it's ready to go you don't even have to
punch it down first
just transfer it right into your skillet
and then press it to the edges leaving a
bit of a rim my dough's a little cold
still I just pulled it from the fridge I
should have pulled it out earlier but I
wasn't really as prepped as I thought I
was that's alright if it's giving you
any resistance you can just cover it and
let it sit for a few minutes and then
continue stretching it mine is actually
stretching beautifully because it's been
in the fridge for several days
fermenting so that glutens are nice and
relaxed and the dough is very elastic
and I'm just gonna drizzle the top with
even more oil it can take more than you
could ever think in a skillet pizza it's
almost end up similar to focaccia and
then get that plastic in the dough
Oh cover this this needs to sit for
about 20 minutes to proof again and
while it's doing that and warming up we
can prep all of our toppings stay tuned
[Music]
okay our ingredients are prepped the
dough has rested for 20 minutes then the
oven is preheated to 475 degrees I know
I said 425 my bad I'm at 475 now the
dome might retract a little bit as mine
has but I'm just gonna use the plastic
wrap that I have covered with to press
it back out all the way to the edge of
that hand and I still have clean hands
love that okay
season the dough with salt and pepper
little non-traditional but I always do
make sure everything has plenty of
flavor and then you just layer on your
ingredients you can start with cheese or
sauce I kind of like to layer for a
skillet pizza so I'm gonna do some
cheese some sauce and then a little more
cheese with the rest of the toppings and
Beyond really prepping out your
ingredients this is a super fast thing
to make any day of the week good for a
lunch or dinner
and skillet pizza's thicker so it can
take more toppings than a thin crust
pizza can will certainly hold up to that
all right now a little more cheese oh I
also found shiitake mushrooms in the
fridge so I slice up a few of those a
little more flavor I'll never pass up a
mushroom on a pizza when given the
opportunity but really you can make any
kind of pieces you want put any topping
on it you want whatever you have in the
fridge the one thing I do like to put on
the very top is the sausage because it's
raw I want to make sure that gets plenty
of direct heat to cook through and
Chryst a little bit and again because
it's skillet pizza it takes longer than
a thin piece of thin crust pizza will be
ready in anywhere from seven to ten
minutes depending on how hot your oven
look at a skillet pizza like this will
take anywhere from 18 to 22 minutes so
it does require a little bit more time
okay fresh oregano YUM
and a sausage on top and the ricotta
can't forget about that
this is looking so tasty
and then just a few dollops of ricotta
cheese I like the freshness of a ricotta
or a feta here that creaminess is nice
too when you bite into it and that's it
into the preheated 475 degree oven 18 to
22 minutes don't forget to set your
timer
[Music]
this skillet Pizza Diavolo is fresh from
the oven and fill my apartment with the
most gorgeous aroma I really wish you
were here
to smell it and taste it with me while
it was baking off I put together a very
quick simple salad of baby arugula and
half cherry tomatoes simply dressed with
good extra virgin olive oil and
champagne vinegar salt and pepper that's
it if you've already got your pizza
dough made and ready to go this whole
thing takes less than 30 minutes to pull
off I hope you'll try it at home thanks
for watching and I wish you good health
and happy eating
